Post Description:
I could not hold my annual Chap Goh Mei dinner with community leaders and other guests this year because of COVID-19. Instead, I spoke to a small audience at NTUC Auditorium, while groups joined us from 126 other locations virtually.

I took stock of our COVID-19 situation. We want to maintain our current stable position and get Singaporeans vaccinated quickly. The vaccines will take us one big step forward, but not back to business as usual, as many countries will not complete their vaccinations within this year. We have to live with the virus for many more years to come, maybe even permanently.

I also shared my thoughts on our external situation, and the outlook for the future. The next few years will not be easy. We can‚Äôt tell exactly how the world will change after the pandemic, but as long as we work together, hold fast to our principles, and keep faith both with our pioneers as well as generations yet unborn, we will emerge stronger and thrive for many years to come. ‚Äì LHL
 
(MCI Photo by Chwee)
Comments: Very nice daddy lee hsien loong

Post Description:
Pleased to see the safe arrival of the first batch of Moderna‚Äôs COVID-19 vaccine this afternoon, earlier than expected. The Health Sciences Authority has given interim authorisation to use this vaccine in Singapore.

Our vaccination programme is proceeding smoothly. The latest delivery will allow us to continue as planned. More vaccination centres will open soon across Singapore. I hope seniors will book their appointments when their turn comes, so that we can all stay protected together. 

Until then, do continue to follow safety regulations, wear masks, and remember safe distancing! ‚Äì LHL

(MCI Photo by Zinkie Aw)
Comments: Very nice daddy lee hsien loong

Post Description:
Got my second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at Singapore General Hospital (@sghseen) this morning. With that I have completed the full vaccination regimen.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Just like my first jab, it was quick and painless. The doctors watched me for 30 minutes afterwards, just in case. Happy to share that I feel fine.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
We are ramping up the vaccine programme and opening more vaccination centres. Do go for your vaccination when your turn comes. It will protect not only yourself, but also your family, friends and everyone you come in contact with. ‚Äì LHL

Post Description:
Our COVID-19 vaccination programme is underway.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
I‚Äôve already had my jab, and am due for my second dose soon. Some Ministers have also been vaccinated, to show confidence in the vaccine.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
When your turn comes, I strongly encourage you to take it up too. Especially seniors like myself, for whom COVID-19 can be a serious and dangerous illness. Vaccination will not only protect yourself from COVID-19, but also help keep your loved ones safe. ‚Äì LHL

Post Description:
We began vaccinating seniors 70 and above in Ang Mo Kio and Tanjong Pagar today. These two estates have older residents than most other estates.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
I dropped by Ang Mo Kio Polyclinic this morning to see how the pilot exercise was going. Pleased to see a good turn out today!
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
The vaccination programme will be rolled out to other estates from mid-February. If you have seniors at home who have received the letter, please help them make their appointment for their vaccination. I encourage everyone to get vaccinated as soon as you can. The more of us are protected, the sooner we can get back to a more normal life. ‚Äì LHL
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
(MCI Photos by Fyrol)‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Comments: Go for it when offers.  The pandemic is raging with variants and will not disappear by itself.  Other than those who are pregnant or have extreme allergy, don't be afraid of the jab that are meant to protect u.

Post Description:
Was at Singapore General Hospital (@sghseen) this morning to take a look at the start of COVID-19 vaccinations for healthcare workers from public institutions today. I also got my first dose of the jab!

It was quite painless, with the tiny needle and the steady hands of Senior Staff Nurse Fatimah Mohd Shah. I was observed for 30 minutes after getting the vaccine but I am happy to report that I feel fine and have no side effects.

I am confident that the vaccine is safe and effective. We will have ample vaccines for everyone, so I hope Singaporeans and long-term residents will get vaccinated when your turn comes, and help keep everyone safer. ‚Äì LHL

([1,2,4,5] MCI Photo by Fyrol; [3] Photo by me)
Comments: Thank you for leading by example PM Lee! So grateful for your leadership! üôÜüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüôÜüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Post Description:
Was at Singapore General Hospital (@sghseen) this morning to take a look at the start of COVID-19 vaccinations for healthcare workers from public institutions today. I also got my first dose of the jab!

It was quite painless, with the tiny needle and the steady hands of Senior Staff Nurse Fatimah Mohd Shah. I was observed for 30 minutes after getting the vaccine but I am happy to report that I feel fine and have no side effects.

I am confident that the vaccine is safe and effective. We will have ample vaccines for everyone, so I hope Singaporeans and long-term residents will get vaccinated when your turn comes, and help keep everyone safer. ‚Äì LHL

([1,2,4,5] MCI Photo by Fyrol; [3] Photo by me)
Comments: Thank you Sir, you are the best leader! üëè

Post Description:
Got my first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine today, together with Director of Medical Services A/Prof Kenneth Mak. We got vaccinated early to show Singaporeans we are confident that the vaccine is safe and effective.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Prof Mak and I were monitored for 30 minutes after the jab, just in case we developed any side effects, e.g. allergic reactions. Happy to report that we both felt fine.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Today we started vaccinating healthcare workers from public healthcare institutions. We aim to start vaccinating elderly people from February, and then other Singaporeans and long-term residents.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Vaccinations are voluntary, but I hope that when it‚Äôs your turn, you will go for it. It will be free, it will protect you and your family, and it will help keep everyone safe. ‚Äì LHL
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
(PMO Video by Alex Qiu)‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä

Post Description:
Today we began COVID-19 vaccinations, with 30+ healthcare workers at the National Centre for Infectious Diseases. It marks a new chapter in our fight against the pandemic. 
 
In the coming weeks, the vaccine will be rolled out to more healthcare institutions. We will begin vaccinating the elderly from February. Thereafter we will do other Singaporeans and long-term residents who are eligible for vaccination.
 
The vaccine is key to living in a COVID-19 world, but it will still be some time before this storm will pass. Meanwhile, let‚Äôs stay vigilant to keep ourselves and our loved ones healthy and safe. ‚Äì LHL

Post Description:
Delighted to see the first shipment of vaccines arrive in Singapore on flight SQ7979 ‚Äì a welcome ‚Äòpresent‚Äô that we‚Äôve all been looking forward to!

The Multi-Ministry Taskforce will announce details of the rollout in due course, so do stay tuned. We are prioritising our healthcare workers and the elderly. Vaccination will be voluntary, but I encourage Singaporeans to take the vaccine. 

It‚Äôs been a long and arduous year. I hope that this news will give Singaporeans cheer this festive season, and reason to be optimistic for 2021. ‚Äì LHL

(MCI Photo by Betty Chua)

Post Description:
It has been a long year. But because of our collective efforts against COVID-19, we are ready to ease into Phase 3 on 28 December. This is possible because of all of you who made many sacrifices, so that our numbers and situation are now under control.

We will also provide free, voluntary vaccines for all Singaporeans and long-term residents. We have approved the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine for use, and the first batch will arrive by the end of 2020. We are still looking at other candidates, and by 3Q2021, we should have enough vaccines for everyone. 

I encourage that you get vaccinated, because you are not just protecting yourself, but people around you. This announcement will bring some year-end cheer to you and your friends and family, but we must maintain our vigilance as the virus is not yet eradicated. It might be a year or more before we are in the clear, but at least we can see light at the end of the tunnel. ‚Äì LHL

(MCI Photo by Chwee)
Comments: We should read book , if we want peace and kindnessüåπ
